title: I think you're sacrificing readability for motion in your art.
body: Or, to put it more simply, in an attempt to make your splashes look cool, you make it so it takes me a couple of seconds to figure out what the hell I'm looking at. Kat's art is the most obvious, but most of the new default splashes have this problem. I know, I know, it's supposed to look action-y and dramatic, but it really just seems sloppy and just not thought out very well. You're trying to sell people on your champions with splash art; it doesn't make much sense to have to make someone look at the splash for a couple of seconds before they can figure out what's even going on. 'Is that her knee? What the hell is going on with her legs?  Is this some sort of assassin? I'm confused.'

With so much focus on action poses (or whatever the term), you'd think they'd want the actions to make sense.

They need to stop this mess with the hyper-cartoony super exolosions and move back into the smoky realistic art style like is on Garen and Ashe.
Hell, even some of the other newer looks have been great, like the cop Trundle/Volibear, thief Evelyn/Twitch, Hearseeker Varus, Sweetheart Annie, and the Marauder and Warden skins on the PBE. The latter 4 champions of Gnar, Azir, Kalista, and Rek'Sai, and Sion all look stunning and not overly crazy. But whoever their new artist is that's doing these newer works for the female splashes is just overdoing it and needs to have his/her work toned down.
